reviews.text: Grillled fish tacos were amazing!

Very nice mex place with good service and food.

BUT - we were there for less than an hour and our clothes stink of grease/kitchen - really a bummer.
Cold food, ok flavors. Not worth the money
Muy antipÃ¡ticos, no tenÃ­an ganas ni de trabajar, ni de explicar, ni de vender ni bÃ¡sicamente de nada. Para no dejar propina y para no volver, aunque la comida estuviese bien

Iâ€™m so sad Mexicue moved from 5th Ave, it used to be my favorite spot to go on my lunch break. The tacos were perfect, all the different kinds. And the bartenders were always great! iâ€™ll have to find some time to come by the new location!
Had the shrimp burrito and my husband had a fish tacos and nashville tacos. It was all very delicious. We also had the avocado with chips. We would visit again.

Quesadilla was so good and waiter was great. But the seating needs to be rethoughtâ€¦ tables and chairs were packed too tightly and restroom access was tough.

Always a great experience ! Delicious food and drinks

DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU WANT MEXICAN FOOD. this is NOT real mexican food. as a mexican from california i was APPALLED that this could even be classified as mexican food. the tacos were okayâ€¦ but they didnâ€™t use 2 tortillas and they had weird meat options. I normally gravitate towards carne asada and chorizo tacos but they did not have that (how!?). The tacos are outrageously priced aswell. Iâ€™m talking 8-11 dollars PER TACO. and before you come at me and say â€œitâ€™s NYC everything is expensiveâ€ guess what? Iâ€™ve had 7-8 tacos in the BAY AREA CALIFORNIA (very expensive area) for $25!!! They also did NOT give me a lime for my tacos. If you are going to charge me so much the LEAST you could do is give me a lime. That being said, it is a clean place and itâ€™s decorated nicely (hence the 2 stars not 1) and our server was nice i guess. But ultimately I will be PASSING on this place. Do NOT waste your time.
Surprising expensive for amazingly disappointing â€œMexicanâ€ food & drink. Will not return or recommend.
Nice cosy place for a taco. Affordable dispite they are close to time Square.
Amazing food and drinks , service was good too . We liked the ambience. We took our friends here and they. Loved it too .
Excellent! Great midtown Mexican! Servers were great and food was delicious! Get brisket tacos and queso!!

The food was not the best and the service was okay.

I got the pork birria taco and chips and salsa. The tacos were 8.75 PER taco so I spent 17.50 on two. So it was quite pricey. The tacos were okayâ€¦ they were very sweet. The consome was sweet and even the hot sauce they provided was sweet. It was nothing like the birria tacos I was expecting. It comes with pineapples, pork, and onions that werenâ€™t stated in the menu. In the picture, you can see the consome next to the taco and thatâ€™s literally all you get of it. The tortilla was also undercooked. It was mushy and thick. The other picture of it is literally how thick it was. The chips and salsa were okay too. The salsa was good. Really liked it. I got medium spicy and thought that was a pretty good level of spicy as someone who enjoys spicy food. The chips however were a little stale, chewy and a little hard to bite into. Oh and my friend got orange juice that was really watered down.

The staff were welcoming when we got in and the server we had came over to check if our food was okay and gave us water like once. However, when ordering he did seem a little rude. He seemed unmotivated and he ignored my friend who was still ordering and moved onto me. Compared to the other server he really didnâ€™t seem that nice. However, the wait time for food wasnâ€™t that bad. I didnâ€™t time it because I forgot to but I think it was roughly 15 minutes?

The atmosphere was okay too. The restaurant is clean and nicely decorated. It wasnâ€™t very busy when we visited. It was just me and my friend and another group. Other than music it was very quiet. Felt a little awkward being there.

Overall, not the best for me but if you like sweet tacos then go for it.

Essen ist sehr gut, kÃ¶nnen die Nachos und Quesadillas sehr empfehlen. Ambiente sehr nett, man fÃ¼hlt sich wohl. Unbedingt eine Jacke mitnehmen, sehr kÃ¼hl dort. Personal war auch sehr freunllich, schade war nur, dass sie einem mehr oder weniger zu einem Tip gedrÃ¤ngt hat beim Zahlen, da mehrmals darauf hingewiesen wurde, dass der Preis keinen Tip enthÃ¤lt. Sollte immer noch die freie Entscheidung eines Gastes sein, ob man Trinkgeld gibt oder nicht. War hier nicht der Fall, da einem beim Zahlen auf die Finger geschaut wird.
Showed up 8:30pm, restaurant less than half full. Turned away because theyâ€™re closed? Even though hours say until 9. Seemed pretty rude. No take out either.
Good food, good prices, good portions. Our niece who is a local, recommended it and she was absolutely right.

Surprisingly tasty Mexican joint located in the belly of the beast that is Times Square! If you find yourself for whatever reason in this wretched area and want some good food that really doesnâ€™t belong at this location please go in Mexicue! The design is fun and chill, the staff are lovely and the food is right on point! Super tasty, fresh and cooked to order, honestly I might come to Times Square just to eat here again! Well done guys a diamond in a difficult rough!

Great food, great atmosphere and even greater services..

I fell in love woth their Brisket Tacos, they're just magical...
Highly recommend Brisket tacos! The best!
Marissa service was amazing! She was able to explain to us all the promotions and recommend the best dishes. If you want some good tacos please stop here!

Excelente lugar, buena comida y buen ambiente.
Agradecido con el servicio que nos dio la estimada Marissa.ğŸ˜„
Very tiny portions ..i got 2 tacos for 18 bucks .wth. tacos are street food. There was nothing great about the tacos. Stop this robbery!!
Buon cibo messicano vicino Bryant Park. Servizio un po' sotto la media.
Amazing spin on birria tacos coming from a Mexican from Texas! Very cute place nice atmosphere, but better food and great margaritas!

Absolutely loved this place! The food was incredible, and the staff were super friendly and welcoming. I enjoyed it so much that I actually went twice during my stay in New York. If youâ€™re into Mexican food, this spot is a must-visit!

Great place to stop in for dinner the food is fresh the brisket is delicious. They have mocktails as well as a full bar. They brisket is moist and just falls a part in your mouth. The chips hold up to the guacamole.

We walked into Mexicue by chance, just looking for a good Mexican spot near our hotel. From the start, the place caught our eye, and the food kept our interest. Everything we ordered was genuinely delicious â€” from the nachos with poblano cheese and guacamole to the birria in wheat tacos and the quesadilla.

But the real highlight was Juliana. Her kindness and the way she is simply won us over. She made us want to come back, even if just to spend a little more time with her. A wonderful person, a great moment, and very good food.

The food here is spectacular and the strawberry margarita was probably one of the best Iâ€™ve EVER had. Service was *so* speedy and staff are exceedingly friendly and attentive. I was so impressed, all around.  My partner and I are both vegan and they have a very fair offering of plant based options. They were out of cashew cheese the evening I was there, but their cashew vinaigrette is absolutely incredible; Iâ€™d seriously buy a bottle of that stuff on the reg to have at homeâ€¦ Definitely hope to return to MEXiCUE. :)
Hele vriendelijke bediening, geven je tijd. Heerlijk gegeten echt een aanrader ook qua prijs zeer goed in balans

Took a group of coworkers here for lunch and it was a great find.  I needed to find a place that everyone would enjoy and be able to find something to eat as we had a few dietary restrictions. I got the barbecue fajitas with mushrooms and it was amazing! The vegetables were so fresh and I loved the cashew vinegrette that was served with it.  Their beans and rice were excellent as well. I got the corn tortillas on the side which seemed to be homemade and were some of the best I've had. The dish was quite large so I took home some leftovers. They have a large drink menu including a few mocktail options as well. I tried the Paloma from the mocktail menu which was refreshing. They have two hot sauces as well including a more mild one and a habanero one.  The mild one had a really nice smokey flavor. The space is small so it is a good idea to make reservations for a group.
Mega dobre,duÅ¼e,kolorowe i pyszne potrawy
Fantastic food with more than enough vegetarian options. Shamim was an amazing waiter with great drinks/food recommendations. The place had a nice vibe and we thoroughly enjoyed it
Great food and service .
Fantastic food at a great price. Heavily recommend the brisket so freaking good. Worth sitting or stop in!
Pyszne jedzenie. JedliÅ›my Burito i taco. Pomocna obsÅ‚uga, szybko podane i nie jest drogo! Polecam.
The food unfortunately was not good. And the margaritas were not good either. Tex Mex fast food place.
Muy rico y lindo ambiente
A bit cramped but good atmosphere and food
One of my favorite spots for a quick bite and.a.gooood magarita
GÃ©nial, trÃ¨s raisonnable, je recommande
A great spot for dinner, chips and salsa or a happy hour! The burritos were superb! This place is worth a try!
Tasty, not expensive, nice staff, food arrived really fast :)

What a delightful unexpected find in times square perfect for food before show. Sat at the bar had an amazing happy hour likely one of the best bartenders I've ever experienced in my 30 years of being able to drink. Food was excellent staff was great and I wish it were closer because it's the kind of place I would definitely go back to over and over.
My smoky margarita was delicious! Of my 3 tacos, the Cajun shrimp was my favorite, but they were all great.
Heel lekker gegeten hier! Alles heel vers en tegen een zeer aanvaardbare prijs! Een aanrader!
Velmi dobrÃ© jÃ­dlo, pÅ™Ã­jemnÃ¡ obsluha i prostÅ™edÃ­ a za celkem rozumnÃ© ceny na centrum NY
Best Mexican food ğŸ«°ğŸ»

Clean , modern and casual feel. Very tasty food. I'm a big fan of fish , birria and smoked chicken tacos. My nephew loved pork burrito. Delicious charros with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce. Chatty and friendly staff. Great seasonal margaritas.

Un endroit hautement recommandable. La cuisine est pleine de saveurs et de fraÃ®cheur. Les assiettes sont Ã©galement trÃ¨s bien fournies. L'accueil est agrÃ©able.  Mention spÃ©ciale Ã  Marissa, trÃ¨s souriante et Ã  l'Ã©coute. Nous avons passÃ©s un agrÃ©able moment.

So what I really like about this place is that the food is so colorful & vibrant. Adding the sesame seeds makes it more visually appealing as well. The fajitas had vegetables that weren't overcooked and all these other elements that made the dish. The chicken was perfectly cooked, though not very seasoned still enjoyable. The downside is that once you start getting to the bottom of the plate there is a lot, and I mean a lot of oil. The tortillas were homemade and trust me, it makes a difference. The Nachos were stacked. JalapeÃ±os, chopped up peppers, beans, guac, fresh cilantro, and liquid gold ğŸ§€ Yum. Generous portions that allow you to share. Which cuts down the prices. Bill was around $50 w/o tip. Waitress was very courteous and quick.

Mexicue offers a vibrant dining experience with amazing and flavorful food. The dishes are truly delicious and well-prepared. However, the atmosphere can be quite noisy due to the loud music, which detracts from the overall experience. Additionally, the service was a bit slow, which was a minor downside. On a positive note, their cocktails are worth trying and complement the meal well.

These were one of the
best tacos I have ever had in my life! I ordered the Smoky Chicken and Nashville Hot Chicken tacos and the wait for them was so worth it. The Smoky Chicken taco especially blew me awayâ€“the chicken was so incredibly tender and paired wonderfully with the vegetables and tortilla wrap, the sauce sealing it altogether. The atmosphere was incredibly cozy due to the decorations and it didnâ€™t feel as small as it looked, I was quite comfortable at the bar. Iâ€™d have to come back soon to try their other dishes and drinks, since they have an extensive menu.

great place with good ambiance! food was delicious and while itâ€™s not on their menu, they have mushroom as an option for their salads! theyâ€™re also super accommodating of dietary needs and as a vegan Iâ€™ve had great meals there. the drinks are also v good.

servers are helpful and knowledgeable. however, they can be a bit infrequent and slow to come to the table BUT the times Iâ€™ve gone, there have only been 1-2 waiters on the floor with lots of tables so it makes sense and not indicative of their performance!

Wow, just wowâ€”this place is a taco loverâ€™s dream! We did the all-you-can-eat tacos, and they were massive and absolutely delicious. The staff? Total legendsâ€”so friendly and on top of everything. The whole vibe was amazing, and the food was ridiculously good. If you love tacos (and letâ€™s be real, who doesnâ€™t?), you need to check this place out!

Came here randomly for happy hour. They didnâ€™t have a big happy hour menu. An item wasnâ€™t available and they only had corn tortillas (which I like). Ordered brisket and chicken nachos 10/10. Drinks ok. Got a Casamigos shot which was $17 :O. Tacos were okay.

The idea of Mexican food and BBQ caught our eye. We made a reservation which was good since the restaurant is small. We were seated quickly and the one waiter sat us and provided menus. It was awhile before he was back to take our drink order. Decided to order an appetizer when we placed our drink order and went with the nachos. Nachos arrived but no drinks.  Started eating the nachos since they were hot and still no drinks. With a good dent in the nachos the cocktails arrived. They were good but the timing was all off. The nachos were also good. We could have just had those for dinner (shared between 2 of us)  had we realized how big a portion weâ€™d get. I ordered a smoky chicken taco which was also good. It didnâ€™t have that fake smoke taste thankfully and was moist and large as well.

Really great food! The shrimp taco and chicken taco were amazing, avocado taco was also good. Everything was SPICY, including nachos!

Nice quick service and lovely atmosphere. But the staff turned off the music right at 9PM and they visibly wanted everyone to leave quickly.

Stopped by for happy hour which lasted until 6. Accommodating service where we had someone else join us and they were able to move us to a bigger table.  Nachos was a good bang for your buck during HH.

Iâ€™ve eaten here three nights in a row!  It right across from my hotel. The food and service are AMAZING!  So good!  As a diabetic, I can get a skinny margarita and tacos in a lettuce boat!  Love this place!
P.S. Angelica is an amazing bartender and please tell her Hi!  ğŸ’—

I would recommend making a reservation, they were pretty busy and we had to sit near the doors which isnâ€™t a big issue. The place was assume! Our server was helpful with recommendations and the service was fast and quality. The food and drinks had all the flavor youâ€™d hope for. Iâ€™d definitely recommend and return again. Thanks for a great experience!

It was my first time to eat at Mexicue and it didnt disappoint!We ordered chips and guac and elotes for apps and it was good.For entree we did shrimp taco,pork birria taco,fish taco and everything was amazingly good.I would definately come back to try more.

Really amazing food at this restaurant itâ€™s a secret spot near Times Square
We had tacos and nachos and fajitas
Everything was fresh off the oven and tasted so good
Even had the afternoon margaritas spicy margarita and a passionfruit margarita drinks really made wellâ€¦
Really like the blackened fish tacos and the smoky chicken tacos
Will be def going back to try multiple other tacos
Great service by the bartender and the waiter
Super ambience and decor

Great food, but not entirely worth the price & wait. We didnâ€™t have reservations and that was a mistake for a Friday night dinner. Wait time was over an hour, but staff was understanding, checked in on us, and immediately had our tableâ€¦

If youâ€™re craving good Mexican food, this place should be your destination. We ordered the chips and salsa, a bowl of rice with chicken, and the brisket tacos. Everything was absolutely delicious. The flavour were amazing , and each dish was perfectly seasoned. The spicy margarita was outstanding, packed with just the right amount of heat. The staff was incredibly attentive, making the experience even better. I definitely recommend this spot for a fantastic meal and great service

I recently dined at Mexicue, and it was an incredibly disappointing experience. The service was slow, inattentive, and disorganized from start to finish.

We began by ordering guacamole and chips, but the guacamole had a sour, unpleasant taste that made it inedible. After waiting nearly 30 minutes to place the rest of our order because the first server forgot about us, another server finally came byâ€”but she mistakenly delivered a dish we hadnâ€™t ordered. When we told her it wasnâ€™t ours and that we still needed to order, she took her time returning to take it.

We eventually ordered the Pulled Pork BBQ Fajitas and the Brisket Burrito, both of which were disappointing. The flavors were bland, the food lacked freshness, and Iâ€™d rate them a 3/10.

Throughout the meal, the service only got worse. The table was never cleared of empty plates or glasses, and the server didnâ€™t even bother refilling our water. We ordered a second glass of wine when our food arrived, but it never came. After nearly 30 minutes, the server finally apologized, blaming the bartender for being busyâ€”even though the restaurant was nearly empty. The wine eventually arrived about 15 minutes later, but the delay was unacceptable.

Adding to the poor experience, the server brought the check without asking if we needed anything else, left without clearing the table, and didnâ€™t check on us again. The lack of attentiveness and care was shocking and made the experience frustrating.

Overall, Mexicue failed to meet even basic standards of service and food quality. Poor service, bland food, and an overall lack of professionalism made this one of the worst dining experiences Iâ€™ve had. I wouldnâ€™t recommend it.

Nous avons adorÃ© l endroit l Ã©quipe etait super sympa.  Merci beaucoup  Ã  Maryssa pour son sourire et  d avoir pris le temps  de rÃ©pondre Ã  nos questions.  Merci aussi  Ã  l Ã©quipe des cuisiniers  pour leur assiette  savoureuse et aux multiples saveurs. On recommande mais venez le ventre vide ğŸ˜ car la gÃ©nÃ©rositÃ© se ressent dans l assiette.

Staff was really friendly & attentive. We had a couple margaritas for happy hour & they were very good. My only real problem with this place was that they had a C rating for health code inspection which is why we didnâ€™t get any food. If the rating goes up, I will happily be back to try their food as well. If not, its not worth it just for drinks.
Wao! Muy rico todo, desde el servicio de atenciÃ³n con el mesero Karl, que nos asistiÃ³, hasta la comida. Excelente, pueden visitarlo a confianza.
La comida riquÃ­sima y el lugar muy agradable, el personal muy majo. Sirvieron muy rÃ¡pido y la limonada estaba buenÃ­sima!!!!

Had tacos and burritos in this amazing restaurant near Bryant Park.
The food was great and the service quick  and nice. Loved the Cajun shrimp tacos !
The restaurant can be a bit noisy when it is fully occupied but this is manhattan ğŸ˜
On a Monday night there was sufficient space to get seated without a reservation. The portions were great, good quality and well priced. Definitely recommend it!

La mÃºsica es buena para poder comer o simplemente estarla escuchando de fondo, tienen muy buena playlist. El ambiente se siente muy bien con las otras personas pues es acogedor el lugar. El tema es la comida que la verdad es sin sabor, esperaba mucho mÃ¡s por las otras reseÃ±as que habÃ­a visto pero no vale la pena ni asomarse, probÃ© 5 tipos de tacos y ninguno estaba bueno pero la verdad tenÃ­a mucha hambre jaja pero los dos Ãºltimos ahÃ­ los dejÃ© a medias. La calificaciÃ³n es mÃ¡s que nada por el lugar y por el personal que es muy amable

The food is soooo amazing like really really good.  Shrimp,  bbq brisket,cod fish and lobster yes you heard me right lobster tacos are worth the trip to mexicue.  I ordered the chicken quesadilla to top things off.  Chris was so amazing andâ€¦

Luscious, met in your mouth hearty tacos, especially for the pulled pork carnitas, and beef brisket tacos. While seemingly pricey, the quality and flavor is superb. Highly recommend and will return, still tasting and dreaming about these tacos. Convenient to Bryant Park and subways.
Very cute interiors, nice food. Portions were a bit uneven: huge nachos and small tacos (only one per portion). Overall tasty and good atmosphere.
Starters and drinks were great! The fire roasted creamy corn dip was a hit. There were some really good vegetarian options. Some of our entrees were ok...The place had a good vibe!
First time here and had a great experience. You can mix your tacos. I ordered the shrimp and pork and both were delicious. The nachos was an generous sharing size and so delicious!

One of the best foods we have had here in NY on the Time Square area...!!!!! ğŸŒ®ğŸ˜‹
Food is so flavorful, we ordered BBQ burrito, and BBQ taco, Chicken  taco and lobster taco ğŸ‘Œ
The house margarita ğŸ¹ is great, but is missing something, could be better,  as good as the food..
But definitely you should try this place
â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

Vegetarian review: The mushroom taco was ok and it had a cheese that really overpowered it and they didn't really go together well IMO. The broccoli taco was the best of the three options. I wish there was more intensity to flavor however. The corn taco was also decent.

The vegetarian nachos however were quite terrible and flavorless with too many layers of cheese all over. They clearly missed the sauces on one half of the nacho 'mountain' while they chose to use a weird combination of pickled peppers and jalapenos for heat. The jalapeno guacamole is also okay as long as you don't expect any kick from the jalapenos. Their tortilla chips are very good.

This restaurant is not a repeat for me.
